description:
The Lottie Plugin enables you to use high-quality, lightweight animations on your web, Android, and iOS applications. Ideal for adding dynamic and engaging visuals without the need for heavy image or video files, this plugin supports looping, direction control, speed adjustment, and more. 

[b]Usage Features:[/b] 

- Renders animations directly from JSON files.
- Controls for looping, autoplay, speed, and animation direction.
- Supports playing, pausing, and stopping animations programmatically.
- Lightweight and optimized for both mobile and web.
- Ideal for enhancing user interfaces with animations that load quickly and perform smoothly.

[size=5][b]FAQ[/b][/size]

- [b]How do I set up a Lottie animation?[/b]  
Upload your JSON animation file to the plugin's settings or provide a dynamic link. You can control options like autoplay, looping, and direction.

- [b]Can I control the animation speed?[/b]  
Yes, you can adjust the animation speed by setting the desired speed value in the plugin settings.

- [b]Is it possible to play animations in reverse?[/b]  
Yes, the plugin allows you to set the animation direction to play forwards or backwards.

- [b]Can I start, pause, and stop animations dynamically?[/b]  
Yes, you can use actions to play, pause, and stop animations, providing interactive control over when and how animations are displayed.

- [b]What file format is supported for Lottie animations?[/b]  
The plugin supports JSON files exported from Adobe After Effects using the Bodymovin extension. Simply upload or link to the JSON file in the settings.
